text: Overly spiced but thats what happens when Santas pissed off. Cinnamon and clove and nutmeg and probably more.
Bomber - Dark red pour. Nice aroma and taste of cinnamon and roasted nuts. An excellent beer!
Enjoyed at BTBF 2016. Cloudy brown color. Mulling spices on the aroma. Cinnamon. Flavor is dry and spicy. mulling spices but flavorful.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 Great holiday spice and sweet bread aroma. Pleasant burnt caramel color. Full weight with a small head. Bread pudding with an alcohol background. Slightly bitter finish.
Cask at Gman. Pours a mahogany color with a foamy off white head. Notes of roasted nuts, mulling spices, whiskey, and brown sugar. Good but kind of over spiced.

Cask at The Bottle Shop. Dark amber with a small tan head. The aroma is heavy on the spicing with some cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg. The flavor is similar. I get a lot of cinnamon, toffee, alcohol and light chocolate. Medium mouthfeel and light carbonation. Very good beer.
On tap at the brewery. Dark pour with a small brown head. Aroma is cookies and chocolate. Taste is gingerbread, dark chocolate, and dark grain. Great, thick finish.

Pours inky black. Thick creamy white head. Brown sugar, molasses and spice on the nose. Sweet up front with a bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice characteristics of the Winter Warmer with some interesting extra depth by the mulling spices. Flavor of anise and cinnamon meld well into the profile.

Very nice appearance. Dark ale with a frothy tan head. The aroma is very bitter and it tastes just like a gingerbread cookie which is great if youre eating beer for dinner and like desert first. The lacing it leaves on the glass is promo and the finish is like dry cinnamon. Bon appetite!
